intro: Lepidium schinzii, commonly known as Schinz's cress, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by pods that contain several seeds. Lepidium schinzii is often found in high-altitude regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
